data.text:
Nintendo

Nintendo, founded in 1889 as Nintendo Koppai, has a rich history in the gaming industry.

Originally producing handmade hanafuda playing cards, the company ventured into various lines of business before distributing its first console, the Color TV-Game, in 1977. However, it was the release of Donkey Kong in 1981 and the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) with Super Mario Bros. in 1985 that brought Nintendo international fame.

Nintendo became a massive success with its best-selling game, Super Mario Bros., selling over 40 million copies worldwide. Two sequels, Super Mario Bros. 2 and Super Mario Bros. 3, also rank among its top five best-selling games. Other popular titles include Duck Hunt with 28 million units sold and The Legend of Zelda with 6.5 million units.

Popular Games and Franchises

Nintendo has created and published numerous iconic franchises over the years, including

Mario,

Donkey Kong,

The Legend of Zelda,

Metroid,

Fire Emblem,

Kirby,

Pokémon,

Super Smash Bros.,

Animal Crossing,

Xenoblade Chronicles,

Splatoon.

These games have not only been commercially successful but have also received critical acclaim and have influenced the gaming industry in many ways.

Bethesda Game Studios

Bethesda Game Studios is an American video game developer and a studio of ZeniMax Media based in Rockville, Maryland. It is best known for its action roleplaying franchises, including The Elder Scrolls, Fallout, and Starfield.

The first game Bethesda published and developed, based on a popular film franchise, was The Terminator for MS-DOS in July 1991. In 1994, the company released The Elder Scrolls: Arena, the first in The Elder Scrolls role-playing video game series.

In 2004, the Fallout franchise was acquired by Bethesda Softworks from Interplay Entertainment, and the development of Fallout 3 was handed over to Bethesda Game Studios. By 2008, Bethesda Game Studios was considered one of the industry’s top developers on the reputation of The Elder Scrolls fantasy universe and the critically acclaimed Fallout 3.

Popular Games

The Elder Scrolls series:

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind

2. Fallout series:

Fallout 4

Fallout 3

Fallout Shelter (mobile game)

3. Starfield (released in 2023)

These games have received multiple “Game of the Year” awards, and have significantly contributed to Bethesda Game Studios’ reputation as one of the industry’s top developers.

Rockstar Games

Rockstar Games, Inc. is an American video game publisher based in New York City, established in December 1998 as a subsidiary of Take-Two Interactive.

Rockstar Games predominantly took over the Grand Theft Auto franchise from BMG Interactive, which published the series’ original 1997 entry. Since 1999, several companies acquired by or established under Take-Two have become part of Rockstar Games, such as Rockstar Canada (later renamed Rockstar Toronto) and Rockstar Dundee in 2020.

Popular Games

Grand Theft Auto V,

Red Dead Redemption 2,

Max Payne 3,

L.A. Noire.

Square Enix

Square Enix is a Japanese multinational video game publisher formed from the merger of Square and Enix on April 1, 2003.

It is best known for its role-playing game franchises, such as Final Fantasy, Dragon Quest, and Kingdom Hearts.

Popular Games

Final Fantasy (180,000,000 sales)

Dragon Quest (88,000,000 sales)

Kingdom Hearts (36,000,000 sales)

Just Cause (15,000,000 sales)

Mana/Seiken Densetsu (12,340,521 sales)

Drakengard/Nier (10,327,344 sales)

SaGa (10,000,000 sales)

FromSoftware

FromSoftware, Inc. is a Japanese video game development and publishing company founded by Naotoshi Zin in Tokyo on November 1, 1986.

Initially a developer of business software, FromSoftware released their first video game, King’s Field, for the PlayStation in 1994. Its success shifted the company’s focus entirely to game development, leading them to produce two more King’s Field games before creating the mecha combat series Armored Core in 1997, one of their flagship franchises.

However, the company achieved breakout success in the 2010s with Demon’s Souls (2009) and Dark Souls (2011), the latter being the first entry in a trilogy that led to the creation of a subgenre of action role-playing games known as “Soulslike.”

Hidetaka Miyazaki, the creator of the Dark Souls series, has served as FromSoftware’s representative director and president since 2014.

Popular Games

Elden Ring (2022)

Dark Souls III (2016)

Dark Souls (2011)

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice (2019)

Bloodborne (2015)

Armored Core 2 (2000).

Activision Blizzard

Activision Blizzard, Inc. is an American video game holding company based in Santa Monica, California. Founded in July 2008 through the merger of Activision, Inc. (the publicly traded parent company of Activision Publishing) and Vivendi Games, the company owns and operates additional subsidiary studios, as part of Activision Publishing, including Treyarch, Infinity Ward, and High Moon Studios.

Popular Games

Activision Blizzard’s key franchises include

Call of Duty,

Crash Bandicoot,

Guitar Hero,

Tony Hawk’s,

Spyro,

Skylanders,

World of Warcraft,

Diablo,

Overwatch,

Candy Crush Saga.

Take-Two Interactive Software

Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. is an American video game holding company based in New York City founded by Ryan Brant in September 1993. It publishes games through 2K Games, 2K Play, 2K Sports, Ghost Story Games, Private Division, and Rockstar Games.

One of the early successes was “Ripper” in 1996, which had a budget of $2.5 million, with $625,000 used to hire actors. With the rights to “Grand Theft Auto,” Take-Two expanded its publication into North America, and the game became Take-Two’s first financial success with over 1.5 million copies sold.

Popular Games

Some of its popular franchises include

Grand Theft Auto,

Borderlands,

BioShock,

Civilization.

NBA 2K series.

Ubisoft Entertainment

Ubisoft Entertainment SA is a French video game publisher headquartered in Saint-Mandé, France, with development studios across the world. The company was founded on March 28, 1986, by the five Guillemot brothers.

Initially, the Guillemot family had established themselves as a support business for farmers in the Brittany province of France and other regions, including the United Kingdom. In the 1980s, the brothers saw an opportunity in the growing software development business and founded Guillemot Informatique in 1984, which later became Ubi Soft (formally Ubi Soft Entertainment S.A.) in 1986.

The name “Ubi Soft” was selected to represent “ubiquitous” software. Ubi Soft initially operated out of offices in Paris, moving to Créteil by June 1986. In 1996, Ubi Soft went public, raising over US$80 million in funds to help expand the company. Within two years, the company established worldwide studios in Annecy (1996), Shanghai (1996), Montreal (1997), and Milan (1998).

Popular Games

Assassin’s Creed series,

Far Cry,

Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six Siege,

Splinter Cell,

The Division,

XDefiant,

Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora,

Prince of Persia.

Capcom

Capcom Co., Ltd. is a Japanese video game company founded on May 30, 1979, as I.R.M. Corporation by Kenzo Tsujimoto.

Originally focused on manufacturing and distributing electronic game machines, Capcom released its first arcade video game, “Vulgus,” in May 1984.

The company gained recognition with the successful arcade games “Commando” and “Ghosts ‘n Goblins” in 1985, which propelled them to “8-bit silicon stardom.”

Capcom is famous for several world-famous, best-selling game franchises, including the highest-grossing fighting series “Street Fighter,” the best-selling horror series “Resident Evil,” the popular action series “Devil May Cry,” and the hit action RPG franchise “Monster Hunter.”

The company has created over 100 titles that have sold more than one million units. Some of Capcom’s notable franchises and their sales figures include:

Final Fantasy (180,000,000 sales)

Dragon Quest (88,000,000 sales)

Kingdom Hearts (36,000,000 sales)

Resident Evil ($1,407,388,739 gross revenue)

Street Fighter ($217,581,321 gross revenue)

Popular Games

“Monster Hunter: World” (25.30 million units, including “Iceborne Master Edition”)

“Monster Hunter Rise” (14.70 million units)

“Resident Evil 2” (13.90 million units)

“Resident Evil 7 biohazard” (13.30 million units)

“Monster Hunter World: Iceborne” (12.60 million units)

“Resident Evil Village” (9.80 million units)

“Resident Evil 5” (9.10 million units)

“Resident Evil 6” (9.10 million units)

“Resident Evil 3” (2020) (8.70 million units)

“Devil May Cry 5” (8.10 million units)

Naughty Dog

Naughty Dog was founded in 1984 by Andy Gavin and Jason Rubin. The company started by creating educational games for the Apple II computer system, with their first release being a math game called “Math Jam” in 1986.

The company’s first major success came with the release of the 3D action platformer “Rings of Power” in 1994, which was one of the first games to use 3D graphics and featured enemies that were rendered in real-time using texture mapping.
